titles.title: Outside Counsel Fee Limitation Act of 1991
To limit fees paid to outside attorneys who represent the Federal Government.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Operations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Legislation and National Security.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Outside Counsel Fee Limitation Act of 1991 (sic) - Limits the amount of fees paid to outside attorneys who represent the Government to no more than $125 per hour and no more than $1 million per year per attorney or law firm.
